div1.p: Excerpt details orders, letters, and requests regarding Walter Reed's assignments from January 17, 1901 through November 1, 1901. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Surgeon General's Office Record Card for Walter Reed, 1901
div1.p:
Jan. 17, 1901. To the Adjutant Gener-
al of the Army. Sir: I have the hon-
or to recommend that Major Walter
Reed, Surg. U.S.A. be ordered to pro-
ceed from Columbia Barracks, Cuba,
to this city, upon the adjournment
of the Pan-American Medical Con-
gress, Havana, Cuba, to which he is a
delegate by virtue of paragraph 21.
S.O. 302, A.G.O., Dec. 27, 1900, for the
purpose of continuing, in the labor-
atory of the Army Medical Museum,
this city, his investigation with
reference to the cause and preven-
tion of yellow fever.
G.M.S., S.G., U.S.A.

F
B.M.I.
May 14, 1901. Major Walter Reed, Surg.
U.S.A., Wash. D.C. (Through Col. Cal-
vin DeWitt, Presdt. Army Med. Ex. Board
Sir: An explanation is desired with
reference to your absence from your
duties as a member of the Army Med.
Examining Board convened in this
city by paragraph 1, S.O. 28, A.G.O.,
3--958
Write nothing below this line.
of his request by telephone
i.e. until Wednesday May 8th,
and I approved of this absence.
As a matter of fact Major Reed
was absent from May 4th to
May 15th. As there appears to
have been a misapprehension
with reference to the duration
of the absence authorized I
shall give no further consider-
ation to the matter.

G.M.S., S.G., U.S.A.
7 (JFHM)

June 7, 1901. To the Adjutant Gener-
al of the Army. Sir: I have the hon-
or to recommend that Major Walter
Reed, surgeon, U.S.A., be ordered to
proceed at once from this city to Ft.
Monroe, Va., on business connected
with the Med. Dept. on completion of
this duty to return to his station
in this city.

G.M.S., S.G., U.S.A.

Sept. 5, 1901. To the A.G. of the
Army. Sir: I have the honor to
recommend that Maj. Walter Reed,
Surgeon, U.S.A., this city, be de-
tailed as an additional officer
to represent the Medical Dept.
of the Army at the annual meet-
ing of the American Public
Health Assc. to be held at Buf-
falo, N.Y., Sept. 16 to 20, 1901.
It is requested that Major Reed
proceed from this city in time
to reach Buffalo, N.Y., on or
before the 16th of Sept., and
that upon the adjournment of
the Association he return to
his station in this city.

W.H.F.
Asst. S.G.
U.S.A.
